title: Corporate obligations
context: ยง431:6-302 Corporate obligations. An insurer may invest any of its funds in obligations other than those eligible for investment under section 431:6-306 if they are: (1) Issued, assumed, or guaranteed by any solvent institution created or existing under the laws of the United States or of any state, or district thereof; and (2) Filed with the SVO or are considered &ldquo;filing exempt&rdquo; by the Purposes and Procedures Manual of the SVO, or its successor publication. [L 1987, c 347, pt of ยง2; am L 2008, c 142, ยง5]
